definition: stake (in a gamble)/(what is at) stake
to inject/to pour into/to concentrate/to pay attention/stake (gambling)/classifier for sums of money/variant of 註|注[zhu4]

sentences.english: I'm going to stake $2 ob that horse.
sentences.chinese: 我將對那皮馬押2美元賭注。

sentences.english: To surrender means to give up half your wager and not complete the hand.
sentences.chinese: 投降就是放棄您一半的賭注同時放棄這局牌。

sentences.english: Night-before cramming requires playing the odds, and your best bet is on the big stuff.
sentences.chinese: 夜前惡補要有勝算，你最好的賭注應該放在重點上。

sentences.english: For healthy people, insurance is now a bad bet.
sentences.chinese: 對於健康的人來說，保險目前是一筆不好的賭注。

sentences.english: Until you have the expertise, don't bet on an inside straight.
sentences.chinese: 在你擁有這項專長前，不要在撲克中的順子上下賭注。

sentences.english: To bet(an original wager and its winnings) on a subsequent event.
He wanted to win the horse No. 12 by straining his luck.
sentences.chinese: 他想憑他運氣把賭注押在了12號馬上。

sentences.english: Linda,I think we're takin g a chance on this guy.
sentences.chinese: 琳達，我覺得我們是在這個人身上下賭注。

sentences.english: I'm ready to wager you a pound that …
sentences.chinese: 對某匹馬下五英鎊賭注。

sentences.english: I'll bet ten dollars on the chestnut horse.
sentences.chinese: 我要在這匹栗色馬上下十元賭注。

sentences.english: The croupier wished him luck and spun the wheel.
sentences.chinese: 收賭注的人祝他好運，然後將輪盤轉動起來。

sentences.english: They were playing cards for high stakes.
It produces up to 200 books per hour for on-demand bookmaking .
sentences.chinese: 它生產多達200本書，每小時點播賭注。

sentences.english: He risked $100 on the horse race and lost it all.
sentences.chinese: 他下了100美元的賽馬賭注，全輸光了。

sentences.english: However, in leaner times having a daughter is a safer bet.
sentences.chinese: “然而在物資匱乏年代，生女孩是較安全賭注”。

definition: the gains do not make up for the losses (idiom)
to sound out the difficulties and retreat to avoid defeat (idiom); fig. to back out of an awkward situation/to get out on finding out what it's really like
lit. look into one's heart, no shame (idiom); with a clear conscience
to procrastinate/to stall for time/to filibuster
to rack one's brains (idiom); to take great pains to think sth through
to make a comeback/(of a doctor's assessment of the gender of a fetus) to turn out to be wrong
to contend on strong grounds/to argue strongly for what is right
to watch with folded arms (idiom); to look on without lifting a finger
silver currency/currency of the Qing dynasty based on the silver tael 兩|两
